pageContext.claim: “South Korea, we're protecting them with all these different things. I said number one, you got to pay us more. They agreed to. They gave us $500 million a year more. They said, but nobody ever asked. They gave us $500 million.”
pageContext.analysis: False. The Wall Street Journal reported that Trump administration officials sought a 50 percent increase in South Korea’s contribution to a mutual defense agreement. What they got was a much more modest 8.2 percent, with the Korean contribution increasing to $925 million under a one-year deal signed in 2019.
